comments.body: In most files "local" was replaced by "static", where-as here it is added.  Is that an over-sight or intentional?

@pcanal  in crc32, there is introduced a trick https://github.com/oshadura/root/blob/d7eef26043e57146b3fd86d1394045c3d555c773/builtins/zlib/crc32.c#L71,  so local here is not really "local" :) I think it is done to have easier rebase later on zlib/madler, it is not my original code, it is inherited from zlib/cloudflare.
Do we still define 'local' somewhere? (I thought I saw its definition being removed)

```local``` is everywhere, but redefined as  ```#define local static```. I checked cms-externals/cloudflare/gcc.amd64 and it is left there in the same way. The reason is probably to be able to rebase on original zlib. Do you prefer to change me this trick?
fair enough.  Leave it as is.
